metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9608 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The dnxhd decoder in FFmpeg before 3.2.6, and 3.3.x before 3.3.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted mov file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4-1
libavutil55 - 7:3.4-1
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4-1
libswresample2 - 7:3.4-1
libswscale4 - 7:3.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4-1').
